Satshakit USB Hat

After discovering SatshaKit - the project by Daniele “Satsha” Ingrassia of making a fab-equivalent Arduino - I thought that it was a very good idea but it lacked yet of the one of the most peculiar aspects of the famous italian microcontroller: the easiness of use of an USB interface. Hence I delved onto datasheets, pinouts and tutorials to replicate Arduino’s Atmega16U2 block circuitry and adapt it to the standard Satshakit. In this way, you don’t have to throw away your already made SatshaKits and just put a hat on them to enable USB communication.

Welcome

Hello, I’m Antonio from Siena. This is the first post of this portfolio, onto which I’ll cram my works, projects and other casual stuff. There will be some work in progress in the first period, but in the end I hope you’ll a clear view of my skills, interests and achievements.
